references.paper_title: Social LSTM: Human trajectory prediction in crowded spaces
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of human trajectory prediction, providing a key method that many subsequent works build upon.
This paper is highly relevant as it uses vision-based methods for robot policy learning, directly relating to the goals of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Probing the 3D awareness of visual foundation models
references.reason: This very recent work explores the 3D understanding capabilities of foundation models, directly relevant to the task of 3D scene reconstruction.

references.paper_title: Panoptic studio: A massively multiview system for social interaction capture
references.reason: This paper describes a system for high-quality multi-view human motion capture, a standard against which the casual capture method proposed in this work is compared.
This paper introduces activity forecasting based on learning from motion data, setting a strong benchmark for behavior prediction.
